definition: lit. like stepping on a tiger's tail or spring ice (idiom)/fig. extremely dangerous situation
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
surname Chun
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
lit. a caged bird in a pavilion (idiom); fig. to lose vigilance by comfortable living/unaware of the disasters ahead/a fool's paradise
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
Words of benevolence apply universally (idiom). Humanitarian expressions benefit all.
lit. the sun setting and the moon rising (idiom)/fig. the passage of time
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
fine horse/thoroughbred
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
to pander to sb's whims
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
